isis.stitle: CAM AIR FOUNDATION BRAKES - DISASSEMBLY - BRAKE GROUPS WITH BACKING PLATE

figure.caption: Figure 4. Rockwell "T" Series Brake with Backing Plate

step1.para: Remove shoe return spring by using brake pliers, or by using a pry bar or large screwdriver and lifting shoe off the cam. Then remove rollers and retainers (if equipped) from cam end of shoes. Removing rollers first will relieve most of the tension from the return spring, permitting the spring to be disconnected from the shoes.
Remove "C" washers (retainers) from guide pins. Then remove flat washers, cupped washers or coil spring from guide pin. Note position of the spring assembly.
Remove retainer lock rings from anchor pins. Then remove washers, felt retainers and felts from anchor pins.
Lift brake shoes from guide and anchor pins.
The brake shoe anchor pin may now be removed if so desired, by removing the nut and lock washer from the anchor pin, then forcing the anchor pin from the backing plate.

note.para: When removing the automatic slack adjuster, refer to GROUP 04 - BRAKES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

step1.para: With manual slack adjusters, mark the position of slack adjuster in relation to the camshaft and remove clevis pin connecting the brake chamber push rod to the slack adjuster.
Remove the lock ring retaining the slack adjuster to the camshaft, then remove the slack adjuster from the camshaft. Note location of spacers and washers for reassembly purposes.

figure.caption: Figure 5. Eaton Brake with Backing Plate

step1.para: Using a large screwdriver or suitable pry bar, lift upper shoe and remove cam roller and retainer (if equipped).
Remove lower cam roller using the same procedure used for the upper roller.
Remove shoe return spring using a suitable tool.
Rotate lower shoe downward and turn to allow disengagement of shoe from shoe retainer clamp. Remove lower shoe and retainer spring.
Lift upper shoe, rotate, and remove from shoe retainer clamp.
Remove cotter pin and clevis pin from air chamber push rod clevis.

note.para: When removing the automatic slack adjuster, refer to GROUP 04 - BRAKES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

step1.para: With manual slack adjusters, mark position of slack adjuster in relation to camshaft.
With manual slack adjusters, if slack adjuster does not clear chamber push rod clevis, depress locking sleeve and turn adjuster nut until slack adjuster is clear of air chamber push rod clevis.
Remove snap ring, spacer, and washers retaining the slack adjuster to camshaft.
Remove slack adjuster from camshaft. If the slack adjuster is difficult to remove, use a suitable puller.

note.para: Do not use a hammer to remove the slack adjuster or camshaft.

step1.para: Remove camshaft from air chamber bracket.
